articles.author: Ruma Paul, Krishn Kaushik, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: The night before long-time leader Sheikh Hasina abruptly fled Bangladesh amid deadly protests, her army chief held a meeting with his generals and decided that troops would not open fire on civilians to enforce a curfew, two serving army officers with knowledge of the discussions told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Bangladesh army refused to suppress protest, sealing Hasina's fate

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces on Wednesday issued new evacuation orders to Palestinians in areas of north Gaza that were among the first to be hit at the start of the war with Hamas in October, after militants fired a fresh volley of rockets into Israel.
articles.title: Israeli army issues new evacuation orders in north Gaza after fresh rocket fire

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will campaign alongside her new running mate, Tim Walz, on Wednesday, holding events in battleground states Wisconsin and Michigan that will offer an early test of his Midwestern credentials.
articles.title: Harris and Walz to campaign in crucial Michigan and Wisconsin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv kept up air attacks on Russia's Kursk border region on Wednesday, with defence systems destroying four drones overnight, the Russian defence ministry said, a day after Moscow accused Ukraine of targeting the area with an armoured assault.
articles.title: Russia's defence ministry says Ukraine keeps up air attacks on Kursk

articles.author: Ruma Paul, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Bangladesh's protest leaders said they expect members of an interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, to be finalised on Wednesday after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina quit and fled to India following a violent crackdown on a student-led uprising.
articles.title: Bangladesh students expect interim government members to be finalised on Wednesday

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Constitutional Court on Wednesday ordered the dissolution of the popular anti-establishment opposition party, Move Forward, over its controversial campaign to amend a law that protects the powerful monarchy from criticism.
articles.title: Thai court orders dissolution of anti-establishment Move Forward party

articles.author: Jason Lange, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris is drawing more support from Black voters than President Joe Biden did when he was in the race this year, while Republican Donald Trump's support among white voters has risen somewhat in recent months, according to an analysis of Reuters/Ipsos polling.
articles.title: Harris draws more support among Black voters, Trump up slightly among white voters

articles.author: Bianca Flowers, Disha Raychaudhuri
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz's selection as the Democratic vice presidential contender has thrust his handling of racial justice protests following the 2020 murder of George Floyd back into the spotlight, drawing both criticism and praise for his state's response during one of the most tumultuous periods concerning race relations in U.S. history.
articles.title: Tim Walz's handling of George Floyd protests put in spotlight

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Canadian spy agency chief David Vigneault, who stepped down after seven years in that post in July, is joining U.S. security firm Strider Technologies as the managing director of its global intelligence unit, the company said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Former Canadian spy agency chief Vigneault joins US intelligence firm Strider

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas named its Gaza leader Yahya Sinwar as chief of the group following Ismail Haniyeh's assassination in Tehran on July 31, the group said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Hamas names Gaza leader Yahya Sinwar as chief following Haniyeh killing, statement says
